name: Car Companion
body:
### Welcome to Car Companion.
Car Companion will soon be your favourite thing if you have an older car.  This arduino based companion will add heaps of cool features like proximity unlock and dusk sensing headlights.  It's simple to use and will eventually become full of features.  Automatic proximity unlocking and dusk sensing headlights are just the beginning.

### Downloads
Please go to [this page](http://jabelone.github.io/CarCompanion/download) to download the compiled app or app project files.  You will find everything else in this GitHub repository.

### Open Source
Car Companion is 100% open source and always will be.  All hardware and software designs are released under an OSI approved license - the [GPL v3](http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.en.html) or later  Everything else, like documentation, is released under a [CC-BY-SA](http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/au/legalcode) license.

### We're just starting off
Car Companion is in it's infancy, we're just starting to develop some of the core features in both the software and hardware.  It is not recommended to use any of our hardware or software just yet.  It has only had very limited testing and may be quite difficult to set-up unless you're an experienced maker.

### Documentation
At the moment things are changing quickly.  New features are being added and the UI is evolving so it's hard to keep accurate documentation.  Once the project matures a bit more (hopefully by the 1.0 release of the firmware) we promise to create some really great documentation.  

### Authors and Contributors
The author, and maintainer of this project is @jabelone.  If you wish to get involved just follow the standard procedures for contributing to GitHub projects.  Fork it, and make a pull request.  If your code looks good and adds or fixes something worthwhile, it will probably be added.

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with Car Companion?  Please see our FAQ by clicking [here](https://github.com/jabelone/CarCompanion/wiki/FAQ).  If you've found a bug or something that's borked then please open an issue on GitHub and we'll try to help.  Thanks for reading, we hope you enjoy Car Companion as much as we do. :)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
